description: American politics and grassroots social movements from 1945 to the present explored through women's activism and through gender politics more broadly.Â Ideas about gender identities, gender roles, and family in the shaping of social movements; strategies used on the local, regional, national, and international levels. Connections between organizing and policy, public and private, state and family, and migration, immigration, and empire.
